    {"term": "spin quantum number", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "quantum mechanics", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "MRI", "category": "modality"}

  "evidence": [
    "angular momentum describes the rotation of a particle—in this case, the proton.",
    "its magnetic behavior is summarized by the magnetic moment",
    "miu equals gamma times P, where gamma is a constant called the gyromagnetic ratio",
    "angular momentum cannot take on any arbitrary value but is quantized",
    "angular momentum is expressed in terms of the spin quantum number",
    "the proton’s mechanical rotation and its electromagnetic behavior are tied together",
    "This link forms the basis of how MRI exploits proton spins to generate signals"
  ]
}

evidence: angular momentum describes the rotation of a particle-in this case, the proton.
its magnetic behavior is summarized by the magnetic moment
miu equals gamma times P, where gamma is a constant called the gyromagnetic ratio
angular momentum cannot take on any arbitrary value but is quantized
angular momentum is expressed in terms of the spin quantum number
the proton’s mechanical rotation and its electromagnetic behavior are tied together
This link forms the basis of how MRI exploits proton spins to generate signals
